titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Henry Drinker Biddle (1831-1898) was the son of Sally Drinker and James Canby Biddle. His great-grandmother was Elizabeth Drinker (1734-1807). In 1889, Henry Drinker Biddle published Extracts From the Journal of Elizabeth Drinker, from 1759 to 1807. Biddle also compiled a genealogy of his family titled The Drinker Family in America (1893).

scopecontent.p: This is a scrapbook of miscellaneous family papers assembled by Henry Drinker Biddle. Materials include: correspondence to the publishing firm of Key and Biddle; portraits of family members; newspaper clippings; transcriptions of marriage certificates, indentures, and wills; letters, some copied, from various family members, including some written by Biddle as a child; a chart of the Upper Lakes (Michigan) drawn by Biddle; a blueprint of a chain block patented by S.M. Vauclain; and several Confederate bond certificates.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Historical Society of Pennsylvania: Drinker family papers and other family papers collections with Biddle and Drinker family connections.
